intro: Didymoplexis borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean didymoplex, is a climbing vine native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary growth areas. Its unique floral structure makes it an attractive subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
